name: Rubber Stamp
short_description:
***** We do NOT use the bloatware installer! *****

I always felt that paste buffers where you had to memorize a ton of hotkeys wasn't for me.  I can't remember stuff like that - especially if the contents can change often.
I needed a simple interface that would allow me to have a paste buffer, that didn't require me remembering anything.
Designed to be an "always on-top"* application, I leave it in a corner.
Left-clicking the button copies the buffer's contents to the system clipboard.  It's that easy.
I'm in tech support (And have worked as a CSR as well) and am constantly emailing the same things, or using the same memo notes.
No highlighting all of them out of a Word doc or Notepad anymore.  No scrolling.  No selecting.  One click, alt-tab (or click, your preference) and a ctrl-v and it's pasted.
Easy pasting into a buffer: right-click it.
Clear?  Middle-click.
You can lock to prevent overwriting as well.

*there's an option for it that's very easy to access
summary: A simple copy paste buffer designed for one-click usage.
